<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the scholar tell us, must have their

              <sic>misntre</sic>
              <corr>minstrel</corr>
            </choice>. They must</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">have They needed his comment, his buffoonery. <add place="above">his [uncouth?] at [illeg.]</add> They kept him</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in <add hand="ms" place="above">the [illeg.]</add> being, 
            <choice>
              <sic>tolerting</sic>
              <corr>tolerating</corr>
            </choice> <choice>
              <sic>h m</sic>
              <corr>him</corr>
            </choice>, as we tolerate those who say out</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">loud what we feel but are too proud to admit. He used the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">outsiders privilege to co mock the 
            <choice>
              <sic>solmen</sic>
              <corr>solemn</corr>
            </choice>, to comment upon</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the established. The  church men hxmxmxmxmxmxmxxx feared</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and hated <add place="above">hating the</add> the 
            <choice>
              <sic>anonymo s</sic>
              <corr>anonymous</corr>
            </choice> singer. They did their best to <add hand="ms" place="inline">[illeg.]</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If they could, they pressed him and his <add hand="ms" place="above">[illeg.]</add> actors gift into</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the service of the church. He was to be found acting the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Mass in the church; but <add hand="ms" place="above">[illeg.]</add> as he acted more and more his own</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">art, he left the church, and staged his pageant in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">churchyard, or later was given a pitch for his drama in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">market place. Still he remained nameless, often ribald,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">often obscene.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="above">Yet </add>During the silent 
            <choice>
              <sic>centruies</sic>
              <corr>centuries</corr>
            </choice> before the book was printed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">his was the only voice to be heard in England.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Save for <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> singing his song at 
            <choice>
              <sic>yhe</sic>
              <corr>the</corr>
            </choice> back door the English</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">might be a dumb race, a race of merchants, soldiers, 
            <choice>
              <sic>preists</sic>
              <corr>priests</corr>
            </choice>;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">who left behind them stones houses, cultivated fields and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great churches, but no words. <del>He it was</del><add place="above">It was he</add> who gave voice to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the old stories, who incidted the peasants when he came to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the back door to put off their working clothes and deck them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">selves in green leaves. He it was who found words for them</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to sing, and 
            <choice>
              <sic> shen</sic>
              <corr>when</corr>
            </choice> they went at the great seasons to do</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>himage</sic>
              <corr>homage</corr>
            </choice> to the old pagan Gods. He wxxxxxxxx taught them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the songs the  sung at Christmas and at midsummer. He</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">led them to the haunted tree; to the well; to the old</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">burial place where they did 
            <choice>
              <sic>himage</sic>
              <corr>homage</corr>
            </choice> to the pagan gods.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If we could see the village as it was before <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey"><choice>
            <sic>Cahucers</sic>
            <corr>Chaucer's'</corr>
          </choice></rs> time</l>
